image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: ‘Dear Donald’: Trump posts Nato chief’s praise amid Hague summit trip; calls action against Iran ‘extraordinary’ and bold
item.description: President Trump shared messages from Nato secretary-general Rutte, lauding Trump's actions in Iran and his success in pushing allies to commit 5% of their GDP to defense. Rutte affirmed there was no issue with the message's public release. The Nato summit in The Hague, aims to secure lasting European peace, with leaders expected to meet the increased defense spending target.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Thwarted their nuclear project’: Netanyahu declares 'historic victory' in strikes on Iran; ceasefire holds
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared a "historic victory" after a 12-day conflict with Iran, vowing to prevent Tehran from restoring its nuclear infrastructure. Israeli strikes, according to military chief Eyal Zamir, have delayed Iran's nuclear program by years. Despite a ceasefire, Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian asserted Iran's right to peaceful nuclear power.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Texas stabbing: Karmelo Anthony charged with murder for killing Austin Metcalf

item.title: Iran's nuclear facilities 'intact' after US attack? White House says 'top secret assessment' 'flat out wrong'

item.title: Bizarre social media stunt: British man arrested over Disneyland ‘wedding’ with 9-year-old Ukrainian girl; guests were hired
item.description: A British man, a convicted sex offender wanted in the UK, has been charged in France for staging a fake wedding at Disneyland Paris. He allegedly hired actors, including one to play the bride's father, for the ceremony where a nine-year-old Ukrainian girl was the 'bride'. The event, costing an estimated $150,000, was halted by Disneyland staff.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After Pakistan, Republican leader Buddy Carter nominates Trump for Nobel Peace Prize for brokering Israel-Iran truce

item.title: Tight race between Cuomo, Mamdani: When will NYC mayoral poll results be out?
item.description: New York City voters are participating in a crucial Democratic mayoral primary amidst soaring temperatures and a close race. The ranked-choice voting system, where voters rank up to five candidates, may delay the final results. With 11 candidates, including Andrew M Cuomo and Zohran Mamdani, no one is expected to secure over 50% of first-choice votes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Go ahead and try impeaching me, again': Trump names 'stupid AOC', Ilhan Omar, Jasmin Crockett in angry post

item.title: Boom boom Bibi: Netanyahu banks on Iran war for comeback- but would it be his 'phoenix' moment?

item.title: Turbulence hits hard: Five hospitalized after midair chaos on American Airlines flight; FAA investigates
item.description: An American Airlines flight from Miami faced turbulence. The flight landed safely in North Carolina. Five people were hospitalized after the incident. Three crew members and two passengers received medical attention. The seat belt sign was reportedly on. Initial reports suggest injuries occurred during cabin service. The FAA is currently investigating the incident. Further details are awaited.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' husband joins USC law school faculty 'amid difficult moment for legal community'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ceasefire imposed, ceasefire violated: How Iran and Israel disappointed Trump- key developments
item.description: Donald Trump declared a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, but it quickly collapsed with both nations trading accusations and missile strikes. Trump expressed his frustration, particularly with Israel's actions. Israel retaliated to alleged Iranian violations, including a strike that killed a nuclear scientist, while Iran vowed a strong response to further aggression.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who won the war - Iran, Israel or US? No one surrendered, but no one walked away untouched either
item.description: Amidst a week of intense exchanges between Iran and Israel, with the US acting as both aggressor and mediator, a fragile equilibrium has emerged. While missiles flew and bases were targeted, all parties are claiming victory, signaling a desire to de-escalate and avoid further conflict. Despite the heavy costs and ongoing tensions, a path towards diplomacy is cautiously being explored.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Turkey sandwich, sunflower seeds: Strict diet B-2 bomber pilots undergo before missions
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Donald Trump to Benjamin Netanyahu: The biggest winners of the Middle East conflict – and the sorest losers
item.description: In a world defined by chaos, the US reminded everyone who still runs the show. Operation Midnight Hammer, led by Trump and executed with B-2 Spirit bombers, dismantled Iran’s nuclear infrastructure and revived American military swagger. Trump emerged as the ultimate winner, along with Netanyahu and the neocons. Meanwhile, the Axis of Resistance crumbled, Palestine was sidelined, and Pakistan embarrassed itself by nominating Trump for a Nobel before condemning him. China and Russia watched helplessly. As The Newsroom once noted, America leads in defence spending—and now, in reminding the world that it still decides when and how the show ends.
item.dc:creator: Nirmalya Dutta

item.title: 'Killed not because they knew physics but ... ': Israel targets Iran's nuclear brains; kills 14 scientists
item.description: Israel has openly acknowledged its military campaign targeting Iran's nuclear program, which involved the assassination of at least 14 senior Iranian nuclear scientists. According to Israeli officials, these individuals were directly involved in the creation and production of nuclear weapons.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'With smartphones and flight tracking...': Former B-2 pilot on challenges of Operation Midnight Hammer
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New York Mayoral Race 2025: How Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani used the Trump playbook; and shook Gotham
item.description: Mamdani isn’t offering policy. He’s offering vibe. He doesn’t shout at press conferences. He moodily stares into subway cameras while a lo-fi beat plays in the background. He’s the only candidate who could turn a rent-free moratorium into a high-production-value montage. He isn’t asking for your vote—he’s giving you content.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'How angry Donald Trump is': Social media reacts to Trump dropping F-bomb live on TV
